text.content:
<pre>	Insanity and Corruption			Minor Permenant Effects of Corruption. Gaining insanity from warp entities (warp shock) also gives an equal amount of corruption, although it's also gained from other warped sources.				Major Permenant effects of Corruption, if not hidden may quickly lead to the sufferer's flame-induced death at the hands of more radical individuals. Mutations Function as Traits, becoming innate to the Mutant.				The Innate Instability of the Navigator Gene leads to potential Mutations and deformity, progressively making them appear more and more inhuman. Navigators use this table for all mutations,instead of the normal one.				Those that fight in the name of the Dark Gods may be rewarded for their services. As is the nature of Chaos, these rewards can be unpredictable and sometimes detrimental. Loyal Imperial Citizens should never use this.								Those most devoted to the Chaos Gods may earn their favour through acts of deepest Sacrilege.
	Insanity and Corruption Represent the wear and tear of a character's psyche and soul. A Character that reaches either 100 Insanity or Corruption Points is removed from play, going mad in one way or another.
With GM Permission Insanity Points may be removed at a rate of 100xp per Insanity Point. Although cannot go below the current degree of Insanity. This may take the form of prayer, recuperation, or meditation. Corruption however is permenant, bar perhaps an act of divinity.
The Following tables cover Fear/Shock, Mental Trauma, Mental Disorders, Malignancies, and Mutations.
Unimportant NPCs that gain 10+ Insanity/Corruption or permenant effect of either are effectively killed.			Malignancies				Mutation				Navigator Mutations				Gifts of the Gods								Rewards of the Dark Gods
				Every 10 Total Corruption Points gained, Test Willpower or gain a Malignancy. After 30, 60, and 90 Total Corruption points, take a -10, -20, and -30 penalty to the test respectively. Reroll repeat effects.				After gaining more than 30, 60, and 90 total Corruption points, test against two characteristics, pass both or gain a mutation. You cannot test against the same characteristics again. Reroll Repeat Effects. Those in Italics are considered Minor Mutations, if rolling for Minor Mutations, use numbers in brackets on a 100, roll again for full Mutations.				When First Creating a new character, upon failing a +10 Toughness Test made after gaining a new Navigator Power, or if failing mutation test at 30, 60, and 90 Corruption, the Navigator rolls for a mutation. Reroll repeat effects.				Diciples of Chaos Generate Gifts of the Gods at 10, 20, 40, 60, and 80 Corruption Points, or 10, 30, 60, and 90 if a Chaos Space Marine. It can also occur as a result of various Heretical Activities.
If reaching a Corruption threshold through failiure, roll once and gain the result. If through success, can modify result by character's Infamy Bonus, if Unaligned roll twice and choose either result before modifying with Infamy, if aligned roll once but may gain additional bonuses based on alignment. 
If Aligned to a Chaos God, the character may attempt a +0 Infamy Test to gain a Reward from them instead of one of these Gifts.								Whenever a Player aligned to one of the Chaos Gods would earn Gifts from the Gods, they may make a +0 Infamy Test. If successful they gain a Reward  from their Aligned God instead. Failiure simply means they receive the Gift from the Gods as normal, their god not displeased, but simply not finding them worthy enough of a greater reward. To receive a Reward, roll 1d100 for relevent God Table.
				Roll	Name	Effect		Roll	Name	Effect		Roll	Name	Effect		Roll	Name	Effect	Khorne Aligned Bonus Effect	Slaanesh Aligned Bonus Effect	Nurgle Aligned Bonus Effect	Tzeentch Aligned Bonus Effect		Rewards of Khorne			Rewards of Slaanesh
	The sudden effect of a terrifying event. If 10's category of Insanity Points is twice Fear Rating of its source, do not test Fear. At the beginning of each subsequent turn, may be able to test Willpower to try to snap out of shock.			01-10	Palsy	Character suffers from numerous tics, tremors, and shakes. Reduce Ahility by 1d10.		01-05
(01-20)	Grotesque	Take -20 to Fellowship Tests and +10 to Intimidate Tests when interacting with non-mutated people.		01-15	Strangely Jointed Limbs	Your Limbs have extra joints that articulate strangely. Gain Contortionist Skill as a Trained Basic Skill, or gain Talented (Contortionist) Talent if you already have the skill.		1-2	Addiction	The Character develops an all-consuming addiction to some substance, which can be almost anything. GM Decides! During any encounter the character doesn't feed this addiction, they have -10 to all Skill Tests until doing so. May be possible to satisfy prior to an encounter beginning, GM dependant.	-	-	-	-		Roll	Name	Effect	Roll	Name	Effect
	Fear/Shock			11-15	Dark-Hearted	The character grows more cruel and callous. Reduce Fellowship by 1d10		06-10
(21-30)	Tough Hide	Gain Natural Armour (2) Trait due to dense skin and scar tissue.		16-30	Elongated Form	You become incredibly tall and thin, permenantely lose 1d5 Toughness. Reroll if you have the Bloated Form Mutation		3-6	Animal Hybrid	A Mostly Cosmetic change, parts of the character take on an animal form, however they are mentally unaffected. If Unaligned, roll on addendum Animal Table to determine animal mutation. Acting in character with this mutation may award additional Experience Points, GM dependant.	Character takes on the characteristics of a Feral Bull, with Horns and a leathery skin.	Character becomes snakelike, their tongue long and skin smooth and hard	Character's features become sluglike, skin oozing foul slime	Character's body becomes bird-like, legs backjointed, nose and jaw fusiung into a sharp beak.		01-12	Collar of Khorne	A Brass, cruelly spiked collar forged within Khorne's Founderies is forever bound to the character and may never be removed. If the character is directly targeted by a Psychic Power (good or bad), they resist it. Indirect effects, such as telekinesis firing a rock at them still affect as normal.	01-16	Daemonic Name	The Character is granted a secret name of impossible syllables by the prince of pleasure. They gain +1d5 Infamy, however if discovered by a foe, they gain +1 Infamy/Fate Point when battling the character. This reward can be gained multiple times.
	Test Fear (Willpower), with (-0, -10, -20, or -30 for Fear(1,2,3, or 4) source, if fail roll Shock Table with +10 per degree of failiure. In addition to rolled effect, Suffer -10 to skills/Test needing concentration and try to avoid source of fear. Sources of fear that are Warped in nature also give equal Corruption to enemy Fear Rating (aka Warp Shock)			16-20	Ill-Fortuned	When using a fate point roll a d10 on a 7 or above. It does nothing, but is still lost.		11-15
(31-40)	Misshapen	The Spine and Limbs become horribly twisted, character can no longer run and reduces Agility Characteristic by 2d10.		31-45	Pale and Hairless Flesh	Your Skin is a pale white, marbled with veins, and without any hair.		7-9	Bestial	Character's Physical appearance and mannerisms devolve bestially. Permenantly Reduce Intelligence and Willpower by 1d10+5 (separate rolls). Increase Strength by 1d5+1. Roll on Addendum Animal Table to determine animal mutation. 	-	-	-	-		13-24	Daemonic Name	The Character is, for the singlest instant, recognised by Khorne. The are bestowed a True Daemonic Name, becoming known to the Realm of Chaos. They gain 1d5 Infamy. Can be taken multiple times. If an enemy discovers this name, they gain 1 Fate/Infamy point to use against you.	17-32	Daemon Weapon	The Character gains a Slaaneshi Daemon Weapon bound with the essence of a Daemonette
	Roll	Effect		21-22	Skin Affliction	The character is plagued by boils, scabs, and sores. -20 to all charm tests.		16-20
(41-50)	Feels No Pain	Gain +5 Wounds and Iron Jaw Talent due to caring little for harm or injury.		46-55	Eyes as Dark as the Void	Your eyes are completely black, with no iris. Gain the Dark Sight Trait.		10-11	Blood Substition	Character's Blood is altered strangely. Whenever they suffer damage that leads to Blood Loss, one random character within 1 metre makes -10 Agility Test or suffers 1d10 Impact Damage. 	Character's Blood is boiling Lava, the damage gains the Flame Quality.	Character's Blood is corrosive, the damage gains the Tearing Quality.	Character's Blood consists of writhing maggots, the damage gains the Toxic Quality.	Character's blood emits waves of warp energy, test to avoid is -20.		25-36	Daemon Weapon	The Character is gifted with a Daemon Weapon bound with the essence of a Bloodletter.	33-48	Face of Slaanesh	The Visage of the Character becomes both horrifying and beautiful to behold, transfixing or terrifying all that look upon it. The Character gains Fear(2) (or increases Fear by +1 up to max of 4), and gains Peer (Mortal Followers of Slaanesh)
	01-20	Character is badly startled. May only take a single Half Action on next Turn, but afterwards he may act normally.		23-25	Night Eyes	Light is uncomfortable to the character. -10 to all tests made while in bright light.		21-25
(51-60)	Brute	Become Physically powerful as a result of slabs of muscle. Increase Strength and Toughness by 10		56-60	Withered Form	Your Body becomes withered as your flesh hangs from your bones. Permenantely reduce Strength by 10 and halve movement rates. Reroll if you have the Bloated Form Mutation.		12-13	Blasted Senses	Character loses one randomly determined sense (sight, hearing, smell, or touch), however they gain Heightened Senses Trait for a different, randomly determine sense. At GM discretion, a Cybernetic Augmentation restores lost sense, but character still suffers -10 to all Awarness Tests with it.	-	-	-	-		37-48	Face of Khorne	The Character is bestowed with the visage of the Blood God. They gain Fear(2), or +1 to their Fear Rating (max 4) if they already have Fear(2) or greater. They also gain Peer(Mortal Followers of Khorne).	49-64	Hermaphrodite	The Character becomes both Male and Female, or neither, typically reflected by a single breast. They are seen as attracted to male and female alike. Whenever they pass an Interaction Test, double the number of Degrees of Success by which it is passed.
	21-40	Fear grips the character and they begin to shake and tremble. –10 penalty on all Tests for the rest of the encounter or until snapping out of it (by making Willpower Tests on subsequent turns).		26-30	Morbid	The character struggles to concentrate due to grim visions and gloomy trains of thought. Reduce Intelligence by 1d10.		26-30
(61-70)	Nightstrider	Gain Keen, yet sensitive Eyesight. Gain Dark Sight Trait. But take -10 to all tests in bright light unless your eyes are shielded and skin covered.		61-65	Bloated Form	Your Body becomes grossly bloated and your limbs thicken. Gain  +5 Wounds and the Sturdy Trait, but you may no longer run. Reroll if you have Elongated Form or Withered Form Mutation.		14-16	Winged	Mighty Wings sprout from the character's back. They gain the Flyer Trait with a movement speed equal to twice their Agility Bonus.	The Character's Wings are Black and Bat-like	The characters wings are Gossamer-thin Pinions.	The character's wings are like that of an overgrown fly.	The character's wings are of multicoloured feathers.		49-60	Flesh-Fused Weapon	One of the character's Primary Weapons fuses with the character's arms and cannot be removed. It becomes Best Crafsmanship and never needs maintenance nor can it be destroyed or run out of ammunication. Can be made into a Legacy Weapon.	65-84	Mark of Slaanesh	The Character's soul and all its many depravities attracts the Dark Prince of Chaos, The Mark of Slaanesh Talent is bestowed upon the character so that they are driven to yet further extremes. They gain Heightened Senses (All) and Unnatural Fellowship (+2). The Mark may grant further bonuses.
	41-60	Cannot willingly approach the object of fear, –10 penalty on all Tests until the end of the encounter. 
Optional: Gain 1 Insanity Point.		31-33	Witch-Mark	The Character develops a minor deformity or mutation that is easily hideable, but obviously tainted. Some fanatics may take issue with this.		31-35
(71-80)	Mental Regressive	Roll 1d10 for Intelligence, Perception, Willpower, and Fellowship seperately. On a 1-5 reduce by 1d10, on a 6-7 halve characteristic, on 8-9 no change, on 10 reduce characteristic to 5. Also gain 1d10 Insanity Points. The gods give and the gods take ;)		66-70	Membranous Growths	Membranes grow between your skin and digits, sagging and folding from your flesh. Suffer permenant -5 to Fellowship.		17	Blessed Fits	Whenever character spends an Infamy Point to reroll a failed test and then fails on the reroll, they are struck with a seizure that leaves them Stunned for 1d10 Rounds. When they awaken the Infamy Point counts as having not being spent.	-	-	-	-		61-72	Hand of Khorne	One of the character's hands swells in size, nails extending and becoming hard as iron. Attacks made with it do not count as unarmed, and deal 2d10 + Strength Bonus Damage with Pen 8.	85-100	One Thousand and One Senses	The Character gains completely new and nigh incomprehensible senses beyond those of any mortal, such they may seek new and unfathomable experiences. Whenever they pass an Awareness Test, double the number of Degrees of Success.
	61-80	Frozen in Fear, may make no Actions until Snapping out of it (by making Willpower Tests on subsequent turns). Afterwards,  –10 penalty to all tests for the rest of the encounter. 
Optional: Gain 1d5 Insanity Points		34-45	Fell Obsession	Character gains the "Obsession" Mental Disorder. However its focus is something sinister, such as collecting bones, scarification, or torture.		36-40
(81-85)	Malformed Hands	This Mutation causes the hands to fuse into slabs, reduce WS and BS by 10, and take -20 to any test involving fine physical manipulation.		71-75	Inhuman Visage	Your face is devoid of human features, your nose is a pair of slits, ears are small holes, and eyes are unblinking. Gain Fear (1) Trait.		18-19	Steel-Hearted	The Character treats all Fear caused by enemies as one level lower than it is. If enemies have Fear(1), it has no effect on them.	Reduce Fear by one additional level when facing enemy Warriors such as Imperial Guard, Space Marines, etc	Reduce Fear by one additional level when facing enemy faithful of the Corpse-God, such as Sororitas, Priests, etc.	Reduce Fear by one additional level when facing enemy servants of Chaos	Reduce Fear by one additional level when facing enemies with Psychic Abilities.		73-88	Mark of Khorne	The Character is branded with the Mark of Khorne Talent, they gain Resistance (Psychic Powers) Talent, Brutal charge, and Unnatural Strength(+2) Traits. The mark may grant further bonuses or be a pre-requisite to performing Khorne-related rituals or interacting with warp beings.	Rewards of Tzeentch
	81-100	Must flee Source of fear as fast as possible until snapping out of it (by making Willpower Tests on subsequent turns), if prevented from doing so can only take Half Actions with -20 to all Tests. 
Optional: Gain 1d5 Insanity Points.		46-50	Hatred	The character develops an irrational hatred to a particular group or class. They will never side or aid this group unless forced to, begrudgedly		41-45
(86-89)	Tox Blood	The circulatory system is saturated with toxins, gain +20 to toughness tests to resist poison, but reduce Toughness and Intelligence by 1d10. Should this blood spill onto a living creature, they must make a -10 Toughness Test or take 1d10 Damage that ignores AP and Toughness.		76-80	Fingers like Talons	Your fingerbones grow into sharp and hardened talons. Gain Natural Weapons Trait.		20-21	Boneless	Character's Bones dissolve, leaving them weaker but more flexible. They permenantly lose 1d10+10 Strength, but gain 1d5+2 Agility.	-	-	-	-		89-100	Purity of Aggression	The Character is blessed with the clarity of Khorne's Will, driving away all unneccessary emotions except the rawest rage against reality. They gain Enemy(Everyone) and Hatred(Everyone) Talents.	Roll	Name	Effect
	101-120	Character Faints for 1d5 Rounds and can do nothing until awakening, they drop anything they were holding. Afterwards has -10 to all Tests until end of Encounter. 
Optional: Gain 1d5 Insanity Points.		51-55	Irrational Nausea	Character is sickened at the sight of something normally innocuous, such as prayer, books, or bare flesh, and must pass a Toughness test of take -10 to all tests while in its presence.		46-50
(90-94)	Hulking	The body grows in stature and mass. Gain Size (Hulking), increase Strength by 10, and gain +5 wounds.		81-85	Teeth as Sharp as Needles	Your Mouth fills with hundreds of fine, pointed teeth. Gain Natural Weapons Trait, suffer permenant -5 to Fellowship.		22-23	Burning Body	Character is wreathed in flames that do not harm them, this may betray their presence and damage their surroundings. Anyone who lands a barehanded attack or attempts to grapple them must make a +0 Agility Test or immediately take 1d10 E Damage. Character always has a light.	Characters flames possess the heat of Khorne's Forges, dealing 2d10 E Damage but making it impossible for them to hide.	Flames are invisible and produce no light. They do not impede stealth, enemies won't know they're there unless forewarned.	Character is surrounded by Corpse Gas, instead of normal effect, all living creatures in melee make +10 Toughness Test or suffer 1d5 Toughness Damage.	Multicoloured warpfire deals 1 Corruption Point of damage in addition to its normal effects		Rewards of Nurgle			01-11	Changing of the Ways	The Unknowable will of Tzeentch reshapes the character to a form more pleasing to its incomprehensible plans. The Character loses conciousness for 1d10 hours, when they wake up all their Gifts of the Gods are Rerolled. Reroll this is character has no Mutations.
	121-130	Screams and Vomits for 1d5 Rounds, is helpless during this time and drops anything holding. Afterwards can only make Half-Actions for rest of encounter until able to rest. 
Optional: Gain 1d5 Insanity Points.		56-60	Wasted Frame	Character becomes sickenly pale, as their muscles wither away. Reduce Strength by 1d10		51-55
(95-99)	Wyrdling	Gain a Psy Rating of 2, or advance to the next highest Psy Rating. Gain 2 Psychic Techniques of choice from the same Discipline, as long as minimum requirements are met. Do not gain basic technique of the discipline.		86-90	Disturbing Grace	You move with an unpleasent yet fluid grace. Gain Unnatural Agility (x2) Trait.		24-26	Chaos Organ	One of the character's appendages or visible organs is reshaped into a daemonic equivilent. They Choose one of: Natural Weapons, Heightened Senses (Any One), Unnatural Characteristic (+1)(Any One).	The Character grows a set of horns that resembles that of a bloodletter, granting Furious Assault Talent.	One of the Character's Hands is replaced with a Daemonette's Claw, gain Natural Weapons(Claw), it has the has Razor-Sharp Quality and Pen 2. Can't hold things.	The Character's Belly Swells and their entrails push out horribly throw ruptures in their skin. They gain Regeneration(1) Trait	Character gains an additional arm tipped with a claw. They gain Multiple Limbs Trait. They can spend a Full Action to make this limb melt into their body, or reappear at will.		Roll	Name	Effect	12-22	Daemonic Name	To Tzeentch all is known, as so to the character it reveals their Daemonic name. The character gains +1d5 Infamy. however if discovered by a foe, they gain +1 Infamy/Fate Point when battling the character. This reward can be gained multiple times.
	131-140	Laugh Hysterically and randomly attack nearest target, friend or foe, with whatever weapon they have. Lasts until snapping out (by making Willpower Tests on subsequent turns) or unconcious. 
Optional: Gain 1d5 Insanity Points.		61-63	Night Terrors	Character is plagued by daemonic nightmares, gains the "Horrific Nightmares" Mental Disorder.		56-59	Vile Deformity	Gain a Vile, obviously warp-tainted deformity. Be it writhing tentacles, skinless flesh, thousands of eyes, etc. gain Fear (1) Trait. 		91-95	Strange Vitality	Your wounds bleed a translucent fluid, close quickly, and sickeningly knit back together even after being horrifically broken. Gain Regeneration Trait.		27	Cyclops	One of the Character's Eyes is taken in exchange for being able to see something in the future. Unfortunately the only thing they can see is their own death, which they become obssed with avoiding. They Permenantly Lose 1d5 Perception and have the Conspiracy Theorist Disorder.	-	-	-	-		01-14	Corpulent Immensity	The Character bloats and swells, pus weeping from skin that sloughs from them. They are blessed with an unnatural vigour, gaining +5 Wounds but cannot run. They become Size (Enormous).	23-33	Daemon Weapon	The Character gains a Tzeentch Daemon Weapon bound with the essence of a Horror.
	141-160	Crumples to the ground for 1d5+1 Rounds manically sobbing and tearing at their own flesh. 
Afterwards -20 on all tests until the end of the encounter. 
Optional: Gain 1d5+1 Insanity Points.		64-70	Poor Health	The Character suffers from strange illnesses and invisible pains. Reduce Toughness by 1d10		60-63	Aberration	Become an animal hybrid. Increase Strength and Agility by 10, reduce Intelligence by 1d10, and Fellowship by 10.		96-00	Unnatural Presence	Those around you feel unpleasent sensations, a clawing touch, an invisible pressure, a metallic tang, or so on. -10 to positive social interactions, +10 to intimitating or fear-inducing interactions.		28-30	Dark Soul	Character gains Fear(1), or increases their Fear Trait by 1 to a maximum of 4. They radiate the power of the warp.	Warriors know they face a Champion of Khorne. Enemy Warriors such as Guardsman, Space Marines, etc treat the character's Fear Rating as one higher.	The Faithful know they face a force of sacrilege. Those most faithful such as the Sororitas, Inquisitors, and Ecclesiarchy count character's Fear Rating as one higher.	Those lost feel the digusting love of Nurgle embrace them. Renegades and anyone else outside of the Imperium's Bounds count character's fear rating as one higher.	Psykers are disturbed by one chosen by the Architect of Fate. Enemies with Psychic Powers count character's Fear Rating as one level higher.		15-28	Daemonic Name	The Tallymen of Nurgle reveal to the character their Daemonic name, granting them the status of equals amongst the Garden of Decay. The Character gains +1d5 Infamy. If an enemy discovers this name, they gain 1 Fate/Infamy point to use against you. Can be taken multiple times.	34-44	Ecstatic Duplication	The Character is seemingly unchanged. Yet now, if and when they die, they will split into Two Blue Horrors, which themselves will split into two Pink Horrors on death. The Character can choose to burn Infamy to survive and in so doing congeal out of the Horrors at some later point in time.
	161-170	Character's Mind Snaps, goes Catatonic for 1d5 Hours and cannot be roused. 
Optional: Gain 1d10 Insanity Points.		71-75	Distrustful	The character is irrationally distrustful of others, -10 to Fellowship tests made with strangers.		64-67	Degenerate Mind	The Mind is warped beyond humanity. Reduce Intelligence and Fellowship by 1d10.  Roll a d10: 1-3 gain Frenzy Trait, 4-7 gain Fearless Talent, 8-0 gain From Beyond Trait.						31	Dimensional Instability	Once per session, character can choose to become Incoporeal (as described in Incoropreal Trait) for a number of consective rounds equal to their Corruption Bonus.	Whilst Incorporeal, can make -30 Willpower Test to make a melee attack that hits even those not incoroporeal. 	Whilst Incorporeal, can make -30 Willpower Test to gain +30 to all Interaction tests.	Whilst Incorporeal, can make -30 Willpower Test to gain Fear(1), or add +1 to Fear Rating (max 4).	Whilst Incorporeal, can make -30 Willpower Test to use Psychic Powers.		29-42	Daemon Weapon	The Character is gifted with a Daemon Weapon bound with the essence of a Plaguebearer.	45-55	Face of Tzeentch	The Features of the character shift and change along patterns unknowable, eyes, nose, and mouth shifting in disturbing ways. The Character gains Fear(2) or increases Fear by +1 up to max of 4, and gains Peer (Mortal Followers of Tzeentch) Talent.
	171+	Character's Mind Shatters, suffer "Acute Hallucinations" Mental Disorder for 2d10 Rounds, afterwards suffer -20 to all tests until end of encounter. Gain 2d10 Insanity and Permenantly lose 1d10 Willpower.
Alternatively, Character makes +0 Toughness Test or dies from shock. If succeeding instead fall catatonic for 1d5 hours.		76-80	Malign Sight	The character's vision tarnishes if they try to focus. Reduce Perception by 1d10		68-71	Ravaged Body	The Mutant's Body is remade by the warp. Roll 1d5 times on this table (rerolling repeat outcomes), Mutations show the obvious touch of the warp. A rather unpleasent experience.						32-33	Emaciated	Character is drained of their life energy, suffering an eternal hunger that can never be satiated as all but the barest minimum of sustiance they consume is stolen by the warp. They suffer a -20 Penalty from Fatigue as opposed to a -10 penalty.	-	-	-	-		43-56	Face of Nurgle	Nurgle blesses the character with the visage of his own form, the character's face becomes swollen and corpulent. They gain Fear(2) or increase Fear by +1 to a max of 4. They gain Peer(Mortal Followers of Nurgle) Talent.	56-66	Flaming Arm	One Randomly Determined Arm is replaced by a Flamer of Tzeentch, at any time the character can transform the hand into a tooth-wringed mouth that belches warpfire. Profile:
(Range 10m; S/-/-; 1d10+Intelligence Bonus E Damage; Pen 0; Spray, Tainted, Warp Weapon).
	Temporary Effects of Increasing Insanity. Mental Traumas set in after an encounter has concluded.			81-83	Ashen Taste	The character finds food and drink disgusting, and can barely stomach eating. Double negative effects of Fatigue.		72-74	Clawed/Fanged	Gain Razor Claws, a Fanged Maw, or some other Natural Weapon. Gain Natural Weapons Trait, doing either Impact or Rending Damage.						34-35	Eye of Chaos	The eyes of the character may gaze into the Warp as well as reality. They gain the Psyniscience Skill, or advance it by +10 if they already had it.	The Character gains the Intimidation Skill, or advance it by +10 if they already had it. The Rage of the Blood God emanating from their eyes	The Character gains the Interrogation Skill, or advances it by +10 if they already had it. Their eyes seeing through lies and deceit.	The Character gains the Charm Skill, or advances it by +10 if they already had it. Those that look into their eyes see a promise of deliverance from pain and suffering.	The Character gains the Deceive Skill, or advances it by +10 if they already ha it. Their eyes shining a multicoloured hue which dazzles the mind.		57-72	Mark of Nurgle	A Place within the Gardens of Decay is reserved for the Character, branded as a servent of the Plague Lord. Gain Mark of Nurgle Talent The Character gains the Stuff of Nightmares and Unnatural Toughness (+1) Trait. There may also be other bonuses gained from having this.	67-78	Mark of Tzeentch	With the Mark of Tzeentch Talent, the Character perceives a portion of the Architect of Fate's web of schemes. . The Character gains Unnatural Willpower (+1), Psy Rating(+1), and Psyker Trait if they didn't already have it. They become a Bound Psyker to Tzeentch. It may provide other benefits.
	Mental Trauma			84-90	Bloodlust	Character has an underlying murderous bloodlust. If wounded in combat, must test Willpower to not kill enemies outright, even if not intending to.		75-78	Necrophage	Gain +10 to Toughness, and the Regeneration Trait. But can only eat copious amounts of Raw Meat or Starve						36-37	Eye-Stalks	The Character's eyes extend out of their head and wave about on elongated stalks, better able to see but also more vulnerable. Gain 1d5 Perception, but whenever suffering Critical Damage to the head, add 1 to the result. Additionally, they may not be able to wear certain helmets, although the stalks can coil up.	-	-	-	-		73-86	Nurgle's Rot	The Character is blessed with the most pleasing of infections. Character can spend a Full Action to make a Corruption Test, if successful everyone in Corruption Bonus metres suffers 1d10 Damage with Tainted and Toxic(4) Qualities. Ignores non-sealed armour. Nurgle Devoted are Immune.	79-89	Massive Intellect	The Character's mind is enhanced so that they may comprehend some of the incomprehensible machincations of Tzeentch. When passing a Logic Test, they double the number of Degrees of Success.
	Every 10 Insanity Points, Test Willpower or gain a Trauma. Test Modified by +10 (0-39 IP), +0 (40-59 IP), 
-10 (60-79 IP), or -20 (80-99 IP). If test failed add +10 to Trauma roll per degree of Failiure.			91-93	Blackouts	The Character suffers inexplicable blackouts. What occurs in these, and when they occur is up to the GM.		79-81	Corrupted Flesh	The Mutant's internals and organs are replaced by horrifying ichor, maggot-ridden filth, or the like.
